original: A list of top frequently asked  networking interview questions  and answers are given below
result: Below, you will find some of the common questions asked in a networking interview along with their answers. These questions are frequently asked and can help you prepare for your networking job interview.

original: A network is a set of devices that are connected with a physical media link. In a network, two or more nodes are connected by a physical link or two or more networks are connected by one or more nodes.
result: A network refers to a group of devices that are interlinked through a physical media connection. The connection may involve linking two or more nodes, or connecting multiple networks via one or more nodes.

original: A network is a collection of devices connected to each other to allow the sharing of data.
result: A network refers to a group of interconnected devices that enable the exchange of information.

original: Example of a network is an internet. An internet connects the millions of people across the world.
result: A network, such as the internet, is a system that links individuals worldwide. The internet provides a means for millions of people to connect with each other.

original: Network topology specifies the layout of a computer network. It shows how devices and cables are connected to each other. The types of topologies are:
result: Network topology refers to the arrangement and structure of a computer system. It depicts the patterns of interconnection between devices and cables in the network. Different types of network topologies exist, including:

original: Bus topology is a network topology in which all the nodes are connected to a single cable known as a central cable or bus.
result: A bus topology refers to a type of network topology where all the connected nodes are linked to a common cable referred to as a bus or central cable.

original: It acts as a shared communication medium, i.e., if any device wants to send the data to other devices, then it will send the data over the bus which in turn sends the data to all the attached devices.
result: The bus is a communication platform that enables devices to share data with one another. Any device that needs to send data to other devices uses the bus to deliver it to all connected devices.

original: Bus topology is useful for a small number of devices. As if the bus is damaged then the whole network fails.
result: Bus topology is typically appropriate for networking environments with a limited number of devices. However, it has a potential disadvantage in that if the bus encounters any damage, it can lead to a complete failure of the entire network.

original: Star topology is a network topology in which all the nodes are connected to a single device known as a central device.
result: The star topology is a type of network topology where a central device connects all the nodes in the network. Each node in the network can communicate with the central device, which acts as a hub for data transfer.

original: Star topology requires more cable compared to other topologies. Therefore, it is more robust as a failure in one cable will only disconnect a specific computer connected to this cable.
result: The Star topology is known for its high cable usage, which makes it a more reliable option as compared to other topologies. In the event of a cable failure, only one computer connected to that cable will be affected, making it easier to identify and fix the issue.

original: If the central device is damaged, then the whole network fails.
result: In case the central device undergoes damage, the entire network experiences a failure.

original: Star topology is very easy to install, manage and troubleshoot.
result: The installation, management and troubleshooting of star topology is very simple and straightforward.

original: Star topology is commonly used in office and home networks.
result: The star topology is a popular choice for both home and office networks.

original: Ring topology is a network topology in which nodes are exactly connected to two or more nodes and thus, forming a single continuous path for the transmission.
result: A ring topology refers to a networking arrangement where every node is connected to at least two nodes, forming an unbroken communication path.

original: It does not need any central server to control the connectivity among the nodes.
result: A decentralized network does not require a central server to govern the communication between its nodes.

original: If the single node is damaged, then the whole network fails.
result: In the event that one node malfunctions, it can lead to the failure of the entire network.

original: Ring topology is very rarely used as it is expensive, difficult to install and manage.
result: The ring topology is not commonly employed due to its high cost, installation hurdles and complicated management processes.

original: Examples of Ring topology are SONET network, SDH network, etc.
result: A Ring topology is a network topology in which all devices are connected in a circular manner to form a closed loop. This type of network topology is commonly used in telecommunications networks such as SONET and SDH networks.

original: Mesh topology is a network topology in which all the nodes are individually connected to other nodes.
result: A mesh topology refers to a type of network topology whereby each node is directly connected to other nodes.

original: It does not need any central switch or hub to control the connectivity among the nodes.
result: A mesh network does not rely on a central switch or hub for managing connections between its nodes.

original: Fully connected mesh topology
result: The topology that allows all nodes in a network to be connected in a mesh-like structure is known as a fully connected mesh topology. It allows for efficient communication and redundancy in case of node failure.

original: Partially connected mesh topology
result: A partially connected mesh topology refers to a network configuration where some nodes are directly connected to all other nodes, while others are only connected to some nodes.

original: It is a robust as a failure in one cable will only disconnect the specified computer connected to this cable.
result: The network system is highly reliable as the failure of a single cable will only lead to disconnection of the computer that is connected to that specific cable.

original: Mesh topology is rarely used as installation and configuration are difficult when connectivity gets more.
result: The installation and configuration of a mesh topology can be challenging when there are a large number of devices with multiple connectivity paths. As a result, this topology is not commonly used.

original: Cabling cost is high as it requires bulk wiring.
result: The cost of cabling can be quite expensive due to the need for large quantities of wiring.

original: Tree topology is a combination of star and bus topology. It is also known as the expanded star topology.
result: The tree topology is created by combining elements of both the star and bus topologies. It is sometimes referred to as the expanded star topology.

original: In tree topology, all the star networks are connected to a single bus.
result: The tree topology is designed such that multiple star networks are connected to one common bus.

original: Ethernet protocol is used in this topology.
result: This topology utilizes the Ethernet protocol.

original: In this, the whole network is divided into segments known as star networks which can be easily maintained. If one segment is damaged, but there is no effect on other segments.
result: A segmented network architecture is utilized in star network topology, which allows for easy maintenance. If one segment of the network is damaged, it does not adversely affect the other segments.

original: Tree topology depends on the "main bus," and if it breaks, then the whole network gets damaged.
result: The effectiveness of a tree topology relies heavily on its primary trunk line. If the trunk line experiences a failure, it can cause damage to the entire network.

original: A hybrid topology is a combination of different topologies to form a resulting topology.
result: A hybrid topology is created by integrating multiple types of topologies to form a unique network structure.

original: If star topology is connected with another star topology, then it remains star topology. If star topology is connected with different topology, then it becomes a Hybrid topology.
result: If a star topology is linked to another star topology, it will sustain its star topology structure. However, if it is linked to a dissimilar topology, it converts into a Hybrid topology.

original: It provides flexibility as it can be implemented in a different network environment.
result: The implementation of this solution provides adaptability and versatility as it can cater to various network structures and configurations.

original: The weakness of a topology is ignored, and only strength will be taken into consideration.
result: The focus is only on the positive aspects of a topology, while any weaknesses are disregarded.
